title: Steven Gerrard describes what it was like being named Liverpool captain and explains how he lived up to roll
text:
Steven Gerrard describes what it was like being named Liverpool captain and explains how he lived up to roll The Reds legend admitted he was "shocked" when he was named skipper at the age of 23 Share Click   Steven Gerrard talks about being a captain Share this video Get   
Steven Gerrard has revealed his "shock" at being named Liverpool captain and explained how he lived up to the roll. 
The Reds legend, who was interviewed for Copa90, admitted he felt too young for the job when he was named skipper at the age of 23. 
But despite the huge responsibility suddenly being placed on his shoulders, Gerrard remembers the day as "one of the best of my life". 
As he grew into the roll at Anfield, the midfielder looked at other good captains in world football and tried to take a little bit from their games. Steven Gerrard describes what it was like being named Liverpool captain (Photo: Copa90) 
He said he then became more adept to helping the younger players at the football team, who he said looked up to him for guidance. 
"To be the captain of Liverpool is a very privileged position," said Gerrard. 
"I didn't think about it a lot in the younger years, I think the more I got settled the more games I played and the way I played then it became an added dream, an added ambition. Gerrard celebrates with the Champions League trophy (Photo: null) 
"It was a bit of shock how early I got it, I was 23 years of age, I still thought I was a bit young at the time, still learning, still developing. 
"But you know it was a big moment for me and one of the best days of my life really." 
On drawing inspiration from other skippers, Gerrard said: "My experience of captains for Liverpool and England, everyone does it their own way, their own style. The former captain took a coaching roll at the club's academy (Photo: Getty) 
"Some people do it vocal, some people do it in one-to-one situations, some people do it the way they play. 
"I always try to take little bits from all the captains I played with and try to add them into my style." 
Gerrard, who finished his career at LA Galaxy, before returning to Liverpool to take up a coaching roll in the academy, also explained the importance of helping youth players. Gerrard was made Reds skipper when he was just 23 years old (Photo: Getty Images) 
"When you're the captain you have a lot of younger players and a lot of people around the dressing room that look to you to see how you go about your business. 
"So I think the important thing is you have to find consistency, you have to do things on a daily basis right. The Reds hero takes part in a Liverpool Legends game (Photo: B Kanaris/Liverpool FC via Getty) 
"And when it comes down to the crunch and you're actually performing you have to take responsibility. 
"You have to try and do everything in your power to get a result for that football club and hopefully players look at that and try and follow it." poll loading Will Steven Gerrard one day manage Liverpool? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
